physical_appearance: This is a white silk garment. It has a mandarin collar and frog buttons. It is long-sleeved. There are no patterns or embroidery seen.
sgcool_label_text: This silk Chiu Thau has a mandarin collar and frog buttons. It would have been worn by the groom during the hair combing ceremony, which takes place on the first day of the twelve-day wedding celebrations. It is part of a donation which contains a mixture of garments worn by Peranakan men and women.
